The 'Capetian dynasty' , also known as the '[[House of France]]', is among the
largest and oldest European royal houses, consisting of the descendants of King
Hugh Capet of France in the male line. In contemporary times, both King Juan
Carlos of Spain and Grand Duke Henri of Luxembourg are members of this family,
both through the Bourbon branch of the dynasty.
